troubleshooting.title: Cannot Log in to Oxygen Feedback in Chrome

condition.title: Problem
condition.p: I am having trouble logging in to the Oxygen Feedback application in Chrome.

cause.title: Possible Cause
cause.p: Oxygen Feedback uses HTTP cookies to authenticate client requests and maintain session information. The authentication issue could be caused by the browser (or a third-party extension or plugin) rejecting the JSESSIONID authentication cookie. This cookie is used to store the current user's Session ID on the client side (in the browser).

ul.li: Open Chrome's DevTools, go to the Application tab, select the https://feedback.oxygenxml.xom entry in the left navigation pane, and check to make sure the JSESSIONID cookie is present.
Check your current cookies settings to make sure cookies are not blocked (chrome://settings/cookies).

If you have any Chrome extensions installed, it is possible for them to interfere with Feedback's authentication cookies. You could try opening the page in a Chrome Incognito Window and try to log in (by default, all Chrome extensions are disabled in the Incognito mode).
Try using a different browser (e.g. Firefox or MS Edge).
